Big Tech is spending $650B on AI infrastructure in 2026. The market just wiped $430B+ off their valuations in response. The speculative AI era is officially over.

Apple lost $256B in market cap since January. Nvidia shed $89B. Alphabet dropped $87B. Investors are done funding AI ambition without earnings visibility.

$650B flowing into data centers, chips, and power — from just four companies. This is the largest infrastructure buildout since the cloud era, and capital markets are demanding receipts.

AI risk now dominates corporate earnings calls despite strong quarterly growth. Executives are being forced to justify every dollar of AI spend with near-term returns.

## Fact-check notes
- Alphabet, Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft are expected to spend approximately $650 billion in 2026 on AI infrastructure, primarily data centers, chips, and power (Source: AI Strategist News, 02/16/2026)
- Nvidia, Apple, and Alphabet have seen market value declines of $89.67B, $256.44B, and $87.96B respectively since the start of 2026 (Source: Reuters, 02/16/2026)
- Investors are shifting from rewarding long-term AI ambitions to demanding near-term earnings visibility (Source: Reuters, 02/16/2026)
- AI risk is dominating corporate earnings conference calls despite strong quarterly earnings growth (Source: Bloomberg via Japan Times, 02/16/2026)
